item.description:
** Due to the advanced and strenuous nature of this event it is not suitable for beginners **

** Prior experience with travel during winter conditions is required **

** Crampons & Snowshoes are required **

** All cancellations will be posted by 11 a.m. on Saturday morning **

We are hiking to East Osceola (4156') with the option of continuing on to Mt Osceola (4340'). A fine, scenic, forest hike with challenging trails.

We will meet at the Lincoln Woods Visitor Center/trailhead. From here we will carpool to the Greeley Ponds parking area.

We will hike 1.30 mi/+337 ft on the Greeley Ponds Trail to Mad River Notch. At Mad River Notch we then take the Mt. Osceola trail for 1.5 mi/+1851' to the summit of East Osceola (4156'). The Mt. Osceola trail which leads to the east summit from Mad River Notch is steep and rough.

If we choose to continue on to Mt. Osceola (4340') there will be a "chimney" section that will need to be bypassed or ascended directly.

To East Summit only -
Distance 5.60 mi
Elev Gain +2390 ft

To East & Main Summits -
Distance 7.60 mi
Elev Gain +3232 ft



Headlamps, Crampons & Snowshoes are a requirement for this hike. We will likely encounter ice and possibly unbroken trails between the two summits.



Hike time will vary with the pace of the group. This hike has a higher rating of difficulty due to the elevation gain.

Rain cancels. The weather will be reviewed on Saturday Dec 6th. Any cancellations or adjustments will be made by 3 p.m on Saturday Dec 6th.


Please keep your rsvp's up to date.

Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that your qualified to join us on this White Mountain hike.

Carpooling is always advised and a great way to get to know your fellow members.check the status of forest service roads
item.name: Osceola East (with option for Osceola Main)
